title: Can I give both o and A level exams in the same year? - Quora

response.answer_text: There is nothing to stop you (we say take, not give, by the way) from taking both GCSE and A level exams in a given year, or a given series of exams in a year, provided you are properly prepared for them. For most people this won’t be appropriate, since GCSEs are basically preparation for A levels, but sometimes someone needs to take an important GCSE subject like Maths or English as well as their A levels, to meet a university’s requirement, and there is no reason why you can’t.
Provided the student/students have thoroughly prepared and the difference in the examination body time schedule is utilise ,it is possible.
